meanings.definition: Remove from office suddenly and forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The king was deposed by the rebels.
meanings.sent2: The board deposed the corrupt CEO.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel deposed the acorn from its tree.
meanings.sent4: The storm deposed the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The chef deposed the burnt toast in the trash bin.

meanings.definition: Testify to or give (evidence) on oath, typically in a written statement.
meanings.sent1: The witness deposed about what he saw at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: She deposed in court regarding the contract dispute.
meanings.sent3: The parrot deposed about the missing cookies in a hilarious manner.
meanings.sent4: The stars deposed their secrets to the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The diary deposed the daily adventures of the young explorer.

meanings.sent1: The revolution deposed the dictator from his rule.
meanings.sent2: The people deposed the corrupt government through peaceful protests.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deposed the dog from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The sun deposed the darkness of the night with its bright rays.
meanings.sent5: The hero deposed the villain from his evil plans to take over the city.
